text: Carlo Cane (1618–1688) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period. ==Biography== He was born at Gallarate, Province of Varese. He was instructed by Melchiore Gilardini. He copied the works of Morazzone with success, and became a historical painter, particularly in fresco. He painted in fresco a St. Ambrose and St. Hugo in the Certosa at Padua. He also painted landscapes and animals. He died at Milan. There is a second Carlo Cane of Trino, in his History of Trino as having painted in 1600 two altar-pieces for the Benedictine abbey of Locedia. ==References== * Category:1618 births Category:1688 deaths Category:People from Gallarate Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Italian Baroque painters Category:Milanese painters
title: Carlo Cane
